byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: Donald J Trump is formally named Republican nominee for president on second day of Republican National Convention in Cleveland, despite divisive roll call in which 721 delegates voted for others to express party dissent; nomination comes amid criticism of his polarizing campaign and doubts regarding plagiarism blunder during Melania Trump's speech.

headline.print_headline: Trump Claims Nomination, With Discord Clear but Family Cheering
headline.main: Donald Trump Claims Nomination, With Discord Clear but Family Cheering

snippet: With his campaign buffeted by criticism and denying claims of plagiarism, 721 delegates cast their votes for candidates other than the nominee....
lead_paragraph: With his campaign buffeted by criticism and denying claims of plagiarism, 721 delegates cast their votes for candidates other than the nominee.
